website_summaries.verdict: Coming from the TR1 series, the Astral TR1 Junction creates an ideal blend of functionality and versatility. The combination of features gained excellent ratings from various types of users. Its whopping performance in the outdoors is packaged in a lightweight build. To conclude, the Astral TR1 Junction is a hiking shoe that delivers a promising performance.
pros: The Astral TR1 Junction was a very functional hiking shoe according to a multitude of users
The sole received much appreciation from many wearers as it provided exceptional grip on a variety of surfaces
Based on heaps of consumer reviews, the TR1 Junction was very light
It rendered comfort right out of the box, as exclaimed by the majority
Most owners liked its roomy toe box
Its performance on wet and dry lands was superb, as testified by numerous users
Scores of wearers observed that the arch support from the Astral TR1 Junction delivered well
Several hikers testified that it runs true to size
Its ability to dry quickly after a water activity thrilled some adventurers
A couple of gear reviewers admired the versatility of the TR1 Junction from Astral
cons: One user mentioned that sand got into the shoe while walking on the beach

customer_reviews.title: Not very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes about 6 months and the top where your foot bends has torn. The rest of the shoe is wearing great and they're very comfortable. I've probably worn these for 60 days total since they're very breathable and not good in cold snowy weather and this is winter in Wyoming. I'm very disappointed since these are not cheap shoes to buy. I wouldn't recommend. The left shoe has completely torn the right is just starting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why a size 11$89 & size 11&1/2$120
customer_reviews.text: This is my second par of Astral Shoes. My first pair I got at a local outdoor INC & I totally LOVE them(they don’t have the size written on the tongue,like most) so I had no idea what size, so I went for 11(I’m normally a 11) they were way to small. I sent back then looked to re- order I found it odd that the size 11 are $89 yet a size 11&1/2 is $120. No they weren’t on sale when I first ordered them. I understand it might take a little more material for a 1/2 a size bigger only $40 worth 🤔 can anyone explain. I’d appreciate it & be very Grateful
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: An underwhelming experience
customer_reviews.text: While it may seem blasphemous (given the rave reviews that Astral shoes normally receive), I have found these shoes to be underwhelming. For perspective, I purchased the shoes for general use and occasional water-laden use. I had read assorted comments here and elsewhere about how comfortable these shoes are for any type of use, including just traipsing about, but my experience has been quite different. Even after normal breaking in, I find these shoes to be stiff and non-conforming to my feet regardless of their position and movement. These shoes may serve you well in your needs, but that hasn’t been the case for me.
customer_reviews.author: CEB

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual work
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try something similar to the Altra shoes. These are quite comfortable. I wear them for casual work everyday. I drive alot for work. So far been wearing them everyday for 3 weeks. My feet are not too sore. The soles are stiffer then I'm used to but I feel they have good support for my arch. Little tight in the toe box. I'm used to of the wider toe box with the Altra but still a good shoe. I can't comment on the shoes for outdoor activities. But these are great so far for normal Walking and driving for work. They do squeek sometimes on certain floors.
customer_reviews.author: Austin K.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoe ever.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this pair so much, I bought two additional pairs. I’ve always been super hard on my footwear and let me tell you that these have stood up to every challenge. They are super lightweight, breathable, and durable. They resist odor because you can spray them out with a hose and they dry very quickly. The only flaw with the otherwise grippy soles is that a couple of small edges have separated from the shoe, but a little gorilla glue and they’re ready to get back out there! As good on the trail as they are in the water, these USA made shoes will not let you down!
customer_reviews.author: jake dann

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I have a pair of these and one other style of Astrals. Light weight. Breathable. Fits exactly the way they are supposed to. Love ‘em.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Noblitt

customer_reviews.title: Best water shoes out there
customer_reviews.text: I saw these at a swift water training for rescue that I took for the fire department and I had to have them after everyone bragged about them. I love them. They are perfect for water and just to wear in general. I also bought my wife a pair to work in. She also loves them. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After one month my shoe started to fall apart. ...
customer_reviews.text: After one month my shoe started to fall apart. the sole is falling off.
customer_reviews.author: michelle Paquette

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Best river shoes I have ever owned. Comfy as as shoe I’ve owned, light enough to wear any time of the year, drain really well(only have the main drain holes on front, my only negative point), but this shoe still drains really really well
customer_reviews.author: Ewing Carl Carruthers

customer_reviews.title: Best comfort
customer_reviews.text: They run true to size. Bought it for my boyfriend who is 8.5, and the 8.5 fit him perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SIRI

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Astral's I've had. They are perfect to wear to the office and then serve just as good on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Hoochfisher

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are rad
customer_reviews.text: Great style, super comfortable and high quality materials. Get these while you can!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Canavan

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but not as comfortable as I had ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, but not as comfortable as I had hoped for kneeling in a canoe. It's not quite flexible enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. LaVanne

customer_reviews.title: Like the comfort & style
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Versatile hiking shoes. Like the cushioning and negative drop.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Thurman

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, quick to dry
customer_reviews.text: Durable, comfortable, quick to dry, smell free and stylish. I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Ultra light, ultra cool, fit my wide feet comfortably, these have become my go to summer shoe for my active outdoor activities
customer_reviews.author: RobAppleton

product_meta.title: Astral Mens Tri Junction Trail Shoe 7.5 Blue
product_meta.description:
This burly yet lightweight hiker is equipped with our sticky G Rubber Balanced Geometry, and an integral Top Shank for crushing miles of rugged trails or canyon.

Fit: True to size
Weight/shoe: Men's 9 = 309g (10.896 oz)
Foot to ground distance: 21mm heel, 20mm ball
feature_bullets: TRAIL GRIP: Heavy duty 5mm lugs for maximum grip on any terrain; Lightweight and flexible for a comfortable and natural feel; Top Shank midsole reduces foot fatigue and supportive EVA heel cup
EXTRA GRIPPY: High performance G.15 rubber outsole is extra grippy and sticky like tar; Low durometer construction conforms to the ground and provides excellent abrasion resistance
DRAINS WATER: Hydrophobic canvas with protective TPU overlays; Polygiene treated insole eliminates stink; Drainage holes at front and back; Mesh uppers vent hot air to keep your feet cool
BALANCED FEEL: Level footbed promotes balance and agility; Wide forefoot lets your feet and toes spread out for stability; Lightweight enough to believe you're actually barefoot (309g/shoe)
NATURE FIRST: All Astral shoes are vegan; We use recycled polyester and source materials as sustainably as possible and we always promise to put nature first
